qas.question: What functionality did the PlayStation 3 lose in version 3.21 of its firmware update?

What legal action did some disgruntled OtherOS users take against Sony?

context: The <a0_0>'<b5_0>OtherOS<b5_0/>'<a0_0/> functionality was not present in the updated <a3_0><b8_0>PS Slim<b8_0/><a3_0/> models, and the feature was subsequently removed from previous versions of the PS3 as part of the machine's firmware update version 3.21 which was released on April 1, 2010; Sony cited <a1_0><b6_0>security concerns<b6_0/><a1_0/> as the rationale. The firmware update 3.21 was <a2_0><b7_0>mandatory<b7_0/><a2_0/> for access to the PlayStation Network. The removal caused some controversy; as the update removed officially advertised features from already sold products, and gave rise to several <a4_0><b9_0>class action lawsuits<b9_0/><a4_0/> aimed at making Sony return the feature or provide compensation.
